inclusion.criterion: Fluent in English and able to consent
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention any language barriers or inability to consent.

inclusion.criterion: One of the following: (1) s/p ACL reconstruction within the last three months prior to initiation of study training, (2) s/p knee arthroscopy within the last 2 weeks prior to initiation of study training, (3) S/p lower extremity trauma, unilateral with thigh weakness of at least a 20% deficit compared to contralateral side and at least 6 months out from most recent trauma or surgery
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has anaplastic astrocytoma, not ACL reconstruction, knee arthroscopy, or lower extremity trauma.

exclusion.criterion: Contralateral lower extremity involvement resulting in less than normal range of motion, muscle strength, or daily pain greater than 5/10.
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention contralateral lower extremity involvement.

exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: Patient is a 45-year-old man, so pregnancy is unlikely.

exclusion.criterion: Recent history of deep vein thrombosis, within the 12 months or on active treatment
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention deep vein thrombosis.

exclusion.criterion: History of endothelial dysfunction, peripheral vascular disease, hypertension, diabetes, or people prone to capillary ruptures (bruising) (determined by verbal reporting by the patient)
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text mentions hypertension, but does not provide enough information to determine if it is a current issue.

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention any active infections.

exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Patient has anaplastic astrocytoma, which is a current cancer diagnosis.

notes: Patient's cancer diagnosis likely makes them ineligible for the trial. However, more information about their current health status and medical history would be needed to confirm this assessment.
